required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Selective CD28 Blockade in Renal Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Selective CD28 Blockade With Lulizumab Compared to CNI Inhibition With Tacrolimus in Renal Transplant Recipients

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of lulizumab, a CD28-specific domain antibody (CD28 dAb), compared to tacrolimus, as the primary immunosuppressant in first-time renal transplant recipients.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a phase 2a, open-label, prospective, randomized (1:1), controlled, single center study evaluating the safety and efficacy of lulizumab (a CD28 specific domain antibody [CD28dAb]) compared to tacrolimus as the primary immunosuppressant in first-time renal transplant recipients. The study will take place at Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, Georgia, United States (US).
There are two arms/groups in this study, the Control (tacrolimus) group and the Investigational (lulizumab) group. The two arms will be assigned to treatment regimens for the first 12 months after transplantation; at that point, all participants in each arm will be transitioned to a physician directed Standard of Care (SOC) immunosuppressive regimen, and all participants will be assessed at 15 months after transplantation.
All participants will receive induction therapy with Thymoglobulin and Methylprednisolone and maintenance therapy with Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) and Prednisone.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Month 2 to Month 12 Post Transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) will be estimated using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equation. MDRD is an equation (calculation) used to estimate GFR in participants with impaired renal function based on serum creatinine, age, race, and gender.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Remain Free of Biopsy Proven Acute T-Cell Mediated Rejection (aTCMR)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure. Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Remain Free of Antibody-Mediated Rejection (ABMR)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure. Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Incidence of Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Infection(s) of Special Interest
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure. Definition: The occurrence of infection(s) requiring participant hospitalization or prolonged therapy, including but not limited to treatment ≥20 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Viremia
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of BK Polyoma Virus (BKV) Viremia
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Any Malignancy, Including but Not Limited to PTLD
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure. Definitions: Malignancy: A term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues. Post-transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder (PTLD) : A rare but well-known complication of solid organ transplants and hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Experiencing the Composite Outcome of Death or Allograft Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Biopsy Proven Acute T-cell Mediated Cellular Rejection (BPaTCMR)
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Treated for Kidney Transplant Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Definition: Participant requiring treatment for rejection with corticosteroids, T-cell depleting therapy, and/or any other treatment for kidney transplant rejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Treated for Acute Rejection Due to Clinical Suspicion
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Acute rejection due to a clinical suspicion rather than BPaTCMR or BP-aABMR. Definitions: BPaTCMR: Biopsy proven acute T-cell mediated cellular rejection BP-aABMR: Biopsy proven active antibody mediated rejection

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Biopsy Proven Active Antibody Mediated Rejection (BP-aABMR)
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with aTCMR Changes in Allograft Biopsies
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Definitions: aTCMR:acute T-cell mediated cellular rejection Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Event for aTCMR Changes in Allograft Biopsies
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Definitions: aTCMR:acute T-cell mediated cellular rejection Defined by Banff 2017 kidney criteria. Reference: Haas, M. et al. The Banff 2017 Kidney Meeting Report: Revised diagnostic criteria for chronic active T cell-mediated rejection, antibody-mediated rejection, and prospects for integrative endpoints for next-generation clinical trials. Am J Transplant. 18(2):293-307.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participant Who Develop De-Novo Donor Specific Antibody
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Month 2 to Month 15 Post Transplantation
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) will be estimated using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equation. MDRD is an equation (calculation) used to estimate GFR in participants with impaired renal function based on serum creatinine, age, race, and gender.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Delayed Graft Function
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin A1C
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Definition: HbA1c: Glycosylated hemoglobin, a measure of the average plasma concentration of blood sugar (glucose) over the previous three months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days to Event: TCMR
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. TCMR: T-cell mediated rejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days to Event: Antibody mediated rejection (ABMR)
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. ABMR: Antibody mediated rejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days to Event: De-Novo Donor Specific Antibody (DSA) Formation
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days to Event: Graft Loss
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Standardized Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Lipid Profile
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure. Included: Total cholesterol, LDL, HDL, and triglyceride.

arm_group.description: N=27 participants will receive a loading dose of lulizumab on Day 0, the day of surgery. This will be followed by a maintenance dose administered on a weekly basis (weeks 1 through 26 post-transplant), followed by administration every two weeks (weeks 28 through 52 post-transplant). Method of administration: subcutaneously. Dose unit of measure: milligrams (mgs). Plus (+) Standard of Care (SOC) Regimen, per protocol- Renal transplant recipients will receive FDA-approved, immunosuppressive medications according to standard of care at Emory Transplant Center: Induction Thymoglobulin: Administered intravenously, dose unit of measure: mgs. Induction Methylprednisolone: Administered intravenously, dose unit of measure: mgs. Maintenance: Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) administered by mouth twice daily, dose unit of measure: mgs. Maintenance: Beginning the day after methylprednisolone is completed, prednisone will be administered by mouth daily, dose unit of measure: mgs.

N=27 participants will receive tacrolimus initiated according to local standard of care and adjusted over time (maintenance) to target optimal trough levels measured in ng/mL: 0 to 6 months, 7 to 12 months and, thereafter, until completion of study participation. Dose unit of measure: mg/kg. Plus (+) Standard of Care (SOC) Regimen, per protocol- Renal transplant recipients will receive FDA-approved, immunosuppressive medications according to standard of care at Emory Transplant Center: Induction Thymoglobulin: Administered intravenously, dose unit of measure: mgs. Induction Methylprednisolone: Administered intravenously, dose unit of measure: mgs. Maintenance: Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) administered by mouth twice daily, dose unit of measure: mgs. Maintenance: Beginning the day after methylprednisolone is completed, prednisone will be administered by mouth daily, dose unit of measure: mgs.

intervention.description: Lulizumab is a pegylated, humanized monovalent domain antibody construct that is specific for human cluster of differentiation CD28.
Standard of Care: Renal transplant rejection prophylaxis.
Standard of Care: Renal transplant rejection prophylaxis.
Standard of Care: Renal transplant rejection prophylaxis.
Standard of Care: Renal transplant rejection prophylaxis.
Standard of Care: Renal transplant rejection prophylaxis.

link.description: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
Division of Allergy, Immunology, and Transplantation (DAIT)

patient_data.ipd_description: The plan is to share data upon completion of the study in: Immunology Database and Analysis Portal (ImmPort), a long-term archive of clinical and mechanistic data from DAIT-funded grants and contracts.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: On average, within 24 months after database lock for the trial.
